book1.title: You Don't Know JS
book1.subTitle: ES6 & Beyond
book1.author: Kyle Simpson
book1.description: No matter how much experience you have with JavaScript, odds are you don’t fully understand the language. As part of the 'You Don’t Know JS' series, this compact guide focuses on new features available in ECMAScript 6 (ES6), the latest version of the standard.

book2.title: Designing Evolvable Web APIs with ASP.NET
book2.subTitle: Harnessing the Power of the Web
book2.author: Glenn Block et al.
book2.description: Design and build Web APIs for a broad range of clients—including browsers and mobile devices—that can adapt to change over time. This practical, hands-on guide takes you through the theory and tools you need to build evolvable HTTP services with Microsoft

books3.title: Git Pocket Guide
books3.subTitle: A Working Introduction
books3.author: Richard E. Silverman
books3.description: This pocket guide is the perfect on-the-job companion to Git, the distributed version control system. It provides a compact, readable introduction to Git for new users, as well as a reference to common commands and procedures for those of you with Git exp
